directories.move_confirm:
Move this file into the translated segments?

tts.section_description: Upload F5-TTS models into any subfolder of {directory} so you can reuse them for TTS generation.
tts.no_subfolders: No subfolders found in the TTS directory.
tts.target_help: Path is relative to the TTS root (e.g. F5-TTS_custom).

validation.all_files: Select all three files: model, vocab.txt, and config.
validation.vocab_extension: The vocab file must use the .txt extension.
validation.config_extension: The config file must use the .json extension.

help.title: AI Dubbing project page help
help.intro: This page lets you manage the entire project: assemble and run workflows, monitor their status, and access project files.

general.title: General workflow
items: Select the steps you want to run in the modular workflow table.
Fill in the required parameters via the forms linked to each step.
Use the run controls to start, stop, or resume the process.
Check the logs and status indicators to follow execution.

widgets.title: Widget details
items: Review + Continue: Pauses execution at a checkpoint where you can review previous steps, adjust parameters, then use the matching button to continue or rerun the workflow.
Cycle: Enables repeated execution. The "Number of steps to rewind" field defines how many previous runnable steps to include in the cycle.

workflow.title: Workflow section
items: The badge shows whether a task is running; the helper text highlights the current action.
Use the template selector to load saved workflows, and the buttons to save or restore the default list of steps.
Within the table you can toggle steps, set the execution environment, and decide how to handle failures.
The controls start, stop, or resume execution and provide quick access to log and status views.

files.title: Project files
items: The file browser shows the entire project directory, while markers highlight translated segments.
Use the toolbar to upload new files into the root and refresh the list after background changes.
Each entry offers quick actions: open in a new tab, delete, or—where available—move into the translated folder.

previews.title: Preview and helper dialogs
items: Audio, video, and JSON previews open in separate modals where trim tools let you customize files or inspect their contents.
When saving workflows, entering API keys, or assembling parameters, modal forms guide structured input.

workflow.title: Modular AI workflow
workflow.hint: Assemble the steps to run, configure the parameters, then start the workflow.
workflow.info: Select steps available in the scripts folder, configure their parameters one by one, then start the desired workflow. The project name is auto-filled for every step.
workflow.table_hint: Right-click inside the table to insert steps.
workflow.table_empty: You have not added any steps yet.
workflow.log_status: The log appears after the workflow starts.
workflow.tip: Tip: step parameters can be edited individually. The log shows the output of every executed command.

status_texts.enable_steps: Enable at least one step before starting.
status_texts.no_steps_before_widget: There are no runnable steps before the first widget. Use the Continue button.
status_texts.never_run: Workflow has not been run on this project yet.

labels_extra.key_saved_hint: Key is currently saved. Leave empty to keep it.
labels_extra.key_clear_hint: Key will be removed when saved.

messages.already_running: A workflow is already running. Wait for it to finish.
messages.no_steps_before_cycle: There are no runnable steps before the widget for the cycle.
messages.cycle_not_enough_steps: Not enough active steps before the widget for the requested cycle.
messages.cycle_repeat_invalid: Cycle repeat count must be at least 1.
messages.cycle_step_back_invalid: Cycle rewind value must be at least 1.
messages.cycle_complete: Cycle finished. Continuing with the next steps.
messages.widget_continue_hint: Reached widget {name}. Use Continue to proceed.
messages.cycle_next_failed: Failed to start the next cycle run.

log_messages.queued: Task queued – it will start in a few seconds.
log_messages.running: Workflow in progress – follow the steps in the log.
log_messages.cancelling: Cancelling – waiting for the process to stop.
log_messages.failed: An error occurred – open the log to see which step stopped.
log_messages.cancelled: Workflow cancelled – start a new run if needed.
log_messages.completed: Workflow finished successfully – files are available in the project directory.
log_messages.failed_short: Workflow stopped with an error. Check the log.
log_messages.running_short: Workflow is running – the log keeps refreshing.
log_messages.stop_pending: Cancellation requested. Waiting for the process to stop.

run.starting_info: Workflow is starting. The first step may take a few seconds.

errors.start_unknown: Unknown error while starting the workflow.

keys.list_instructions: Provide the following keys before starting: {keys}

templates.load_error: Failed to load the selected workflow: {error}
templates.name_required: Enter a name for the workflow template.
templates.reset_confirm: Reset the step list to defaults?

review.name: Review + Continue
review.description: Open review view and resume manually.

cycle.name: Cycle
cycle.description: Repeat earlier steps multiple times in the workflow.

repeat.label: Number of repetitions
repeat.helper: How many times to repeat the selected block.

step_back.label: Number of steps to rewind
step_back.helper: How many runnable steps before the widget should the cycle repeat.

cycle.help: The cycle widget repeats the specified number of active script steps before the widget for the given count.

status.enable_steps: Enable at least one step before starting.
status.no_steps_before_widget: There are no runnable steps before the first widget. Use the Continue button.

params.title: Edit parameters
params.no_settings: No configuration required for this step.
params.no_widget_settings: No configuration required for this widget.

api_keys.title: Enter API keys
api_keys.instructions: Provide the missing API keys to start the workflow.

audio_modal.title: Edit audio
audio_modal.instructions: Drag on the waveform to select, or use the sliders to set start and end.
